    feature_engineering package¶

    Submodules¶

    feature_engineering.candlestick_patterns_features module¶

    class src.feature_engineering.candlestick_patterns_features.CandlestickPatternRecognizer¶

    Bases: object

    Recognizes various candlestick patterns in trading data.

    mode¶

    The trading mode, either ‘BACKTEST’ or ‘LIVE’.

    Type:

    str

    static Engulfing(df)¶

    Identifies bullish and bearish engulfing candlestick patterns in the provided DataFrame.

    Parameters:

    df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing trading data with ‘open’, ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    Returns:

    Dictionary with keys ‘BullishEngulfing’ and ‘BearishEngulfing’,

    each mapping to a list of integers indicating the presence (1) or absence (0) of the pattern.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, List[int]]

    recognize_patterns(df)¶

    Recognizes specified candlestick patterns within the provided trading data.

    Parameters:

    df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing trading data with ‘open’, ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing binary indicators for each recognized candlestick pattern.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    feature_engineering.custom_features_extraction module¶

    class src.feature_engineering.custom_features_extraction.FeatureExtraction¶

    Bases: object

    Extracts and generates custom features from trading data for use in automated trading systems.

    mode¶

    The trading mode, either ‘BACKTEST’ or ‘LIVE’.

    Type:

    str

    volume_max_window¶

    The maximum window size for volume-based feature calculations.

    Type:

    int

    periods¶

    Dictionary mapping time frame labels to their corresponding rolling window sizes.

    Type:

    Dict[str, int]

    generate_features(data)¶

    Generate all features for the provided trading data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing trading data with appropriate columns.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing all generated custom features.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    feature_engineering.custom_target_tranform module¶

    class src.feature_engineering.custom_target_tranform.FeatureExtractor(ticker_data=<factory>)¶

    Bases: object

    Parameters:

    ticker_data (Dict[str, DataFrame]) –

    extract_features(windows)¶

    Extracts high and low price features for specified window sizes.

    Parameters:

    windows (Dict[str, pd.Timedelta]) – A dictionary of window sizes with keys as identifiers and pd.Timedelta as values.

    Returns:

    A dictionary with the same keys as ticker_data, each containing a DataFrame of extracted features.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.DataFrame]

    ticker_data: Dict[str, DataFrame]¶
    validate_data()¶

    Ensures that all DataFrames in ticker_data contain the ‘close’ column.

    Raises:

    ValueError – If any DataFrame is missing the ‘close’ column.

    Return type:

    None

    feature_engineering.feature_aggregator module¶

    Bases: object

    Parameters:

    • feature_extractor (FeatureExtraction) –

    • indicator_generator (TechnicalIndicators) –

    • order_book_transformer (OrderBookDataTransformer) –

    • cs_pattern_recognizer (CandlestickPatternRecognizer) –

    aggregate_features(ticker_data, order_book_data)¶

    Aggregate features from various components and combine them with the original data.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, DataFrame]

    aggregate_order_book(order_books, is_bid=True)¶

    Aggregates 1-minute order book snapshots into a 5-minute window.

    Parameters:

    order_books – List of dictionaries representing 1-minute snapshots of order books

    Returns:

    Aggregated order book with top 5 bids and asks

    aggregate_order_book_data_to_run_min(order_book_data_dict)¶
    aggregate_ticker_to_run_min(data_dict)¶

    Aggregates 1-minute candlestick data to 5-minute intervals.

    Parameters:

    • data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing 1-minute candlestick data with columns: [‘epoch_time’, ‘open’, ‘high’, ‘low’, ‘close’, ‘volume’, ‘date’]

    • data_dict (DataFrame) –

    Returns:

    Aggregated 5-minute candlestick data.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    feature_engineering.indicators module¶

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.adx(data)¶

    Calculates the Average Directional Index (ADX) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing ADX values for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.atr(data)¶

    Calculates the Average True Range (ATR) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing ATR values for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.bollinger_bands(data)¶

    Calculates Bollinger Bands for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘close’ column.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing upper, middle, and lower Bollinger Bands for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.calc_fib_levels(df)¶

    Calculates Fibonacci retracement levels based on the recent high and low prices.

    Parameters:

    df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’ and ‘low’ columns.

    Returns:

    A Series containing Fibonacci levels with the index matching the last row of the input DataFrame.

    Return type:

    pd.Series

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.calc_ichimoku_cloud(data, i, param)¶

    Calculates Ichimoku Cloud components based on the provided parameters.

    Parameters:

    • data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    • i (int) – The index of the parameter set.

    • param (Dict[str, Any]) – Dictionary containing Ichimoku parameters.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing Ichimoku Cloud components.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, Any]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.cci(data)¶

    Calculates the Commodity Channel Index (CCI) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing CCI values for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.ema(data)¶

    Calculates Exponential Moving Averages (EMA) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘close’ column.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing short and long EMAs for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.fibonacci_retracements(data)¶

    Calculates Fibonacci retracement levels for the provided data using rolling windows.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’ and ‘low’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing Fibonacci levels for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.get_param(func_name)¶

    Retrieves the parameters for a given technical indicator function from the configuration.

    Parameters:

    func_name (str) – The name of the technical indicator function.

    Returns:

    A list of dictionaries containing parameters for the function.

    Return type:

    List[Dict[str, int]]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.ichimoku_cloud(data, conversion_line_period=9, base_line_periods=26, lagging_span2_periods=52, displacement=26)¶

    Calculates Ichimoku Cloud components for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    • data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    • conversion_line_period (int, optional) – Period for the conversion line. Defaults to 9.

    • base_line_periods (int, optional) – Period for the base line. Defaults to 26.

    • lagging_span2_periods (int, optional) – Period for the leading span B. Defaults to 52.

    • displacement (int, optional) – Displacement for the lagging span. Defaults to 26.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing Ichimoku Cloud components for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.macd(data)¶

    Calculates the Moving Average Convergence Divergence (MACD) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘close’ column.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing MACD, signal, and histogram values for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.obv(data)¶

    Calculates the On-Balance Volume (OBV) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘close’ and ‘volume’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing the OBV values.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.rolling_pipe(dataframe, window, fctn)¶

    Applies a rolling window function to the dataframe and concatenates the results.

    Parameters:

    • dataframe (pd.DataFrame) – The input DataFrame to process.

    • window (int) – The size of the rolling window.

    • fctn (Callable[[pd.DataFrame], pd.Series]) – The function to apply to each rolling window.

    Returns:

    A DataFrame containing the concatenated results of the rolling function.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.rsi(data)¶

    Calculates the Relative Strength Index (RSI) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘close’ column.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing RSI values for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.sar(data)¶

    Calculates the Parabolic SAR (Stop and Reverse) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’ and ‘low’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing the SAR values.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.stochastic_oscillator(data)¶

    Calculates the Stochastic Oscillator for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, and ‘close’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing %K and %D values for each parameter set.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    src.feature_engineering.indicators.vwap(data)¶

    Calculates the Volume Weighted Average Price (VWAP) for the provided data.

    Parameters:

    data (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing ‘high’, ‘low’, ‘close’, and ‘volume’ columns.

    Returns:

    A dictionary containing the VWAP values.

    Return type:

    Dict[str, pd.Series]

    feature_engineering.orderbook_features_extraction module¶

    class src.feature_engineering.orderbook_features_extraction.OrderBookDataTransformer¶

    Bases: object

    Transforms raw order book data into structured features for automated trading systems.

    None¶
    add_condensed_order_book_info(data)¶

    Adds condensed information from bids and asks, including weighted prices, total volumes, and spread, and returns it as a DataFrame.

    Parameters:

    data (Dict[str, Any]) – Raw order book data containing ‘bids’ and ‘asks’.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing condensed order book information.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    add_derived_variables(condensed_info_df)¶

    Adds additional derived variables for in-depth analysis, such as buy/sell pressure ratio, intraday price range, and price movement from open to close.

    Parameters:

    condensed_info_df (pd.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing condensed order book information.

    Returns:

    DataFrame containing derived variables.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame

    static calculate_metrics(order)¶

    Calculates total volume and weighted price for a given set of orders.

    Parameters:

    order (List[Dict[str, Any]]) – List of orders, each containing ‘price’ and ‘volume’.

    Returns:

    Series containing ‘total_volume’ and ‘weighted_price’.

    Return type:

    pd.Series

    calculate_weighted_price_and_volume(orders)¶

    Calculates the weighted price and total volume for a list of orders.

    Parameters:

    orders (List[Dict[str, Any]]) – List of orders, each containing ‘price’ and ‘volume’.

    Returns:

    A tuple containing weighted price and total volume.

    Return type:

    Tuple[float, float]

    transform(data)¶

    Orchestrates the transformation of raw order book data for a given symbol and returns combined condensed and derived feature DataFrames.

    Parameters:

    data (Dict[str, Any]) – Raw order book data for a symbol containing ‘bids’ and ‘asks’.

    Returns:

    A concatenated DataFrame containing condensed order book information

    and derived variables.

    Return type:

    pd.DataFrame
